list.title: external:AudioContext
list.description: The AudioContext interface represents an audio-processing graph built from audio modules linked together.

list.title: external:CanvasRenderingContext2D
list.description:
The CanvasRenderingContext2D interface provides the 2D rendering context for the drawing surface
of a <canvas> element.

list.title: external:Collator
list.description:
The Intl.Collator object is a constructor for collators, objects that enable language sensitive
string comparison.

list.title: external:Date
list.description: JavaScript Date objects represent a single moment in time in a platform-independent format.

list.title: external:Event
list.description: The Event interface represents an event which takes place in the DOM.

list.title: external:HTMLAudioElement
list.description:
The HTMLAudioElement interface provides access to the properties of <audio> elements, as
well as methods to manipulate them. It derives from the
{@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLMediaElement HTMLMediaElement} interface.

list.title: external:HTMLElement
list.description:
The HTMLElement interface represents any HTML element. Some elements directly implement this
interface, others implement it via an interface that inherits it.

list.title: external:HTMLImageElement
list.description:
The HTMLImageElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond the regular
{@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement HTMLElement} interface it
also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of
<img> elements.

list.title: external:HTMLStyleElement
list.description:
The HTMLStyleElement interface represents a style element.
It inherits properties and methods from its parent, HTMLElement, and from LinkStyle.

list.title: external:Instrument
list.description: Type of MIDI instrument used by Soundfont Player

list.title: external:JSZip
list.description: A JSZip object

list.title: external:MediaRecorder
list.description:
The MediaRecorder interface of the {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaRecorder_API MediaRecorder API}
provides functionality to easily capture media.

list.title: external:MidiPlayerJS
list.description: MidiPlayerJS is a JavaScript library which reads standard MIDI files and emits JSON events in real time.

list.title: external:NamedNodeMap
list.description:
The NamedNodeMap interface represents a collection of Attr objects. Objects inside a NamedNodeMap are not in any particular
order, unlike NodeList, although they may be accessed by an index as in an array.

list.title: external:Promise
list.description:
The Promise object is used for asynchronous computations. A Promise represents an operation
that hasn't completed yet, but is expected in the future.

list.title: external:Storage
list.description:
The Storage interface of the Web Storage API provides access to the session storage or local storage for a particular domain,
allowing you to for example add, modify or delete stored data items.

list.title: external:jQuery
list.description: A jQuery object

list.title: external:jqXHR
list.description:
The jQuery XMLHttpRequest (jqXHR) object returned by $.ajax() as of jQuery 1.5 is a superset
of the browser's native XMLHttpRequest object.
As of jQuery 1.5, jqXHR objects implement the Promise interface, giving them
all the properties, methods, and behavior of a Promise.

list.title: module:AWT
list.description:
This object contains utility clases for painting graphics and images,
as found in the Java Abstract Window Toolkit

The objects defined here are: {@link module:AWT.Font Font}, {@link module:AWT.Gradient Gradient}, {@link module:AWT.Stroke Stroke},
{@link module:AWT.Point Point}, {@link module:AWT.Dimension Dimension}, {@link module:AWT.Shape Shape}, {@link module:AWT.Rectangle Rectangle},
{@link module:AWT.Ellipse Ellipse}, {@link module:AWT.Path Path}, {@link module:AWT.PathStroke PathStroke}, {@link module:AWT.Action Action},
{@link module:AWT.Timer Timer} and {@link module:AWT.Container Container}.

list.title: module:AWT.Font#_calcHeight
list.description:
The {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TextMetrics TextMetrics} object used
by {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D CanvasRenderingContext2D}
does not provide a heigth value for rendered text.
This {@link http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1134586/how-can-you-find-the-height-of-text-on-an-html-canvas stackoverflow question}
has an excellent response by Daniel Earwicker explaining how to measure the
vertical dimension of rendered text using a span element.
The code has been slighty adapted to deal with Font objects.

Warning: Do not call this method direcly. Use {@link module:AWT.Font#getHeight getHeight()} or {@link module:AWT.Font#getMetrics getMetrics()} instead

list.title: module:JClic
list.description:
This is the main method of JClic

Executes on document.ready().

The method iterates over all div objects with JClic class and creates a {@link module:JClicPlayer.JClicPlayer JClicPlayer}
within them. Each player loads the JClic project file specified in the data-project attribute of
the div tag.

The div elements must preferabily be empty. Inner content may become overlapped by objects
created by the JClic player.

This method exports the global variable window.JClicObject, useful when other scripts
need to make direct calls to the main components of JClic.

The main members of the global variable JClicObject are:

  • JClicObject.JClicPlayer (the {@link module:JClicPlayer} object)
  • JClicObject.JClicProject (the {@link module:JClicProject} object)
  • JClicObject.AWT (the {@link module:AWT} object)
  • JClicObject.Utils (the {@link module:Utils} object)
  • JClicObject.$ (the JQuery object)
  • JClicObject.options (the main options loaded at startup, usually the content of the global variable JClicDataOptions)
  • JClicObject.projectFiles (used by JSONP to store the content of some files when inaccessible to the browser because CORS or other restrictions)
  • JClicObject.currentPlayers (array with references to the players currently running)
  • JClicObject.loadProject (a function that starts a JClicPlayer on a specific div)

list.description: Creates a new JClicPlayer hosted on the specified div, and loads an specific project on it.

list.title: module:Utils.getRootHead

Finds the nearest head or root node of a given HTMLElement, useful to place <style/> elements when
the main component of JClic is behind a shadow-root.
This method will be replaced by a call to Node.getRootNode()
when fully supported by all major browsers.

list.title: module:Utils.getSvg
list.description:
Replaces width, height and fill attributes of a simple SVG image
with the provided values

list.title: module:Utils.getTextNodesIn
list.description: Utility function called by {@link module:Utils.getCaretCharacterOffsetWithin}

list.title: module:Utils.getTriState
list.description: Gets a numeric value (0, 1 or 2) from a set of possible values: false, true and default.

list.title: module:Utils.getVal
list.description: Gets a value from an given expression that can be null, undefined or empty string ('')

list.title: module:Utils.getValue
list.description: Gets the minimal representation of the given value (object, array, string, number...)

list.title: module:Utils.getXmlNodeText
list.description:
Parse the given XML node, known as containing only text elements,
and return its content as a string (when possible)

list.title: module:Utils.getXmlText
list.description: Reads paragraphs, identified by <p></p> elements, inside XML data

list.title: module:Utils.init
list.description: Initializes the global settings

list.title: module:Utils.isEmpty
list.description: Checks if the given value is an empty object, null or a zero-length string

list.title: module:Utils.isEquivalent
list.description:
Checks if two expressions are equivalent.
Returns true when both parameters are null or undefined, and also when both have
equivalent values.

list.title: module:Utils.isNullOrUndef
list.description: Checks if the provided value is 'null' or 'undefined'.

list.title: module:Utils.isSeparator
list.description: Check if the given char is a separator

list.title: module:Utils.isURL
list.description: Checks if the given expression is an absolute URL

list.title: module:Utils.isWordDelimiter
list.description: Check if the given char is a word delimiter

list.title: module:Utils.log
list.description: Reports a new message to the logging system

list.title: module:Utils.mReplace
list.description:
Performs multiple replacements on the provided string
See: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2501435/replacing-multiple-patterns-in-a-block-of-data

list.title: module:Utils.nSlash
list.description:
Replaces all occurrences of the backslash character (\) by a regular slash (/)
This is useful to normalize bad path names present in some old JClic projects

list.title: module:Utils.normalizeLocale
list.description:
Converts expressions of type 'pt-br', 'FR', 'ca_es@valencia'... to the format expected by the i18n system:
lc[_CC][@variant] where 'lc' is a two or three lowercase letter language code, CC is an optional two uppercase
letter country code, followed by an optional 'variant' consisting in letters and/or digits.

list.title: module:Utils.normalizeObject
list.description: Converts string values to number or boolean when needed

list.title: module:Utils.parseOldDate
list.description:
Parse 'date' fields generated by "JClic Author" in format d/m/y, with
variable number of digits.

list.title: module:Utils.parseXmlNode
list.description: Parse the provided XML element node, returning a complex object

list.title: module:Utils.pkg
list.description:
Exports third-party NPM packages used by JClic, so they become available to other scripts through
the global variable JClicObject (defined in {@link module:JClic.JClic})

list.title: module:Utils.reduceTextsToStrings
list.description:
Recursively explore the given object, converting to a string
all attributes with a single attribute named 'text'.
Example:
{a:1, b:{text:"hello"}, c:{d:2, text:"world"}} => {a:1, b:"hello", c:{d:2, text:"world"}}

list.title: module:Utils.roundTo
list.description: Rounds v to the nearest multiple of n

list.title: module:Utils.setAttr
list.description: Fills an object with specific attributes from another data object

list.title: module:Utils.setLogLevel
list.description: Establishes the current verbosity level of the logging system

list.title: module:Utils.setSelectionRange
list.description:
Sets the selection range (or the cursor position, when start and end are the same) to a
specific position inside a DOM element.

list.title: module:Utils.settings
list.description: Global constants

list.title: module:Utils.startsWith
list.description: Checks if the given string starts with the specified expression

list.title: module:Utils.stringToWords
list.description:
Converts a string in an array of objects with 'text' and 'sep' attributes, where 'text' are single words and 'sep'
are the word separators following each word in the sentence.

list.title: module:Utils.svgToURI
list.description:
Encodes a svg expression into a {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/data_URIs|data URI}
suitable for the src property of img elements, optionally changing its original size and fill values.

list.title: module:Utils.toCssSize
list.description: Converts the given expression into a valid value for CSS size values

list.title: module:Utils.zp
list.description:
Returns the two-digits text expression representing the given number (lesser than 100) zero-padded at left
Useful for representing hours, minutes and seconds

list.description: ComplexEvaluator constructor

list.title: module:activities/text/Evaluator.ComplexEvaluator#checkScope
list.description:
When an eror is detected in the analyzed expression, this variable indicates the number of
characters the checking pointer will be moved forward and back looking for a coincident
expression.

For example, comparing the answer "one lardzy dog" with the correct answer "one lazy dog"
will detect an error at position 6 (an "r" instead of "z"). If checkSteps is set to 2 or
greater, the "zy dog" expression at position 8 will be found and evaluated as valid, while
a value of 1 or less will not found any coincident expression beyond the error position, thus
evaluating all the remaining sentence as erroneous.

list.title: module:activities/text/Evaluator.ComplexEvaluator#checkSteps
list.description:
Number of times to repeat the evaluation process if an error is found, eliminating in each
cycle the extra characters that caused the error.

list.title: module:activities/text/Evaluator.ComplexEvaluator#compareSegment
list.description:
Compares two segments of text.
This function should make recursive calls.

list.title: module:activities/text/Evaluator.ComplexEvaluator#countFlagsOk
list.description: Counts the number of flags on the provided array that are zero.

list.title: module:activities/text/Evaluator.ComplexEvaluator#detail
list.description: Whether to detail or not the location of errors found on the analyzed text.

flags useful to indicate where the mistakes are located.

Evaluates the given text against a set of valid matches, returning an array of flags useful

try to find a suitable style scanning down through its own BoxBase, their parent's and, finally,

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid

list.description: Two-dimension array of bytes used as containers of boolean attributes

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#blink
list.description:
Makes the cursor blink, alternating between two states. This method should be called only by
{@link module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#cursorTimer}

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#cellHeight
list.description: The cell height, in pixels

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#cellWidth
list.description: The cell width, in pixels

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#chars
list.description: Two-dimension array of characters

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#countCharsLike
list.description: Counts the number of cells of this grid with the specified character

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#countCoincidences
list.description: Counts the number of coincidences between the answers array and the current content of this grid

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#cursor
list.description: The current position of the cursor

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#cursorBlink
list.description: true when the cursor is "blinking" (cell drawn with {@link module:boxes/BoxBase.BoxBase BoxBase} inverse attributes)

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#cursorEnabled
list.description: Whether the blinking cursor is enabled or disabled

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#cursorTimer
list.description: Controls the blinking of the cursor

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#end
list.description: Stops the cursor timer if not null and active

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#findFreeCell
list.description:
Finds the coordinates of the nearest non-locked cell (non-wildcard) moving on the indicated
'X' and 'Y' directions.

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#findNextCellWithAttr
list.description:
Finds the first cell with the specified attributes at the specified state, starting
at specified point.

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#getCellAttribute
list.description: Gets the specified attribute of a cell

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#getCellBorderBounds
list.description: Gets the rectangle enclosing a specific cell, including the border thick.

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#getCellRect
list.description: Gets the rectangle enclosing a specific cell

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#getCharAt
list.description: Gets the character of the cell at the specified coordinates

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#getCursor
list.description: Gets the current position of the blinking cursor

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#getItemFor
list.description:
For a specific cell located at column rx and row ry, finds the number of words delimited
by wildchars located behind its current position and in the same row and column. Used in
{@link module:activities/textGrid/CrossWord.CrossWord CrossWord} activities to find the definition for a specific cell.

The result is returned as 'x' and 'y' properties of a logical point.

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#getLogicalCoords
list.description: Gets the logical coordinates (in 'cell' units) of a device point into the grid

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#getMinimumSize
list.description: Gets the minimum size of this grid

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#getNumCells
list.description: Gets the number of cells of this grid

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#getPreferredSize
list.description: Gets the preferred size of this grid

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#getScaledSize
list.description: Scales the grid to a new size

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#getStringBetween
list.description:
Gets the text formed by the letters between two cells that share a straight line on the grid.
The text can be formed horizontally, vertically and diagonal, both in left-to-right or
right-to-left direction.

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#isCellOk
list.description: Checks if a specific cell is equivalent to the content of answers at its position

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#isValidCell
list.description: Checks if the specified logical coordinates are inside the valid bounds of the grid.

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#moveCursor
list.description: Moves the cursor in the specified x and y directions.

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#nCols
list.description: Number of columns

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#nRows
list.description: Number of rows

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#preferredBounds
list.description: The preferred bounds of this grid

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#randomChars
list.description: Characters that can be used when randomizing the content of this grid

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#randomize
list.description: Substitutes the current content of all cells with wildcards with a randomly generated char.

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#repaintCell
list.description: Repaints a cell

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#setAllCellsAttribute
list.description: Sets the specified attribute to all cells.

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#setAttribute
list.description: Sets or unsets a specifi attrobut to a cell.

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#setAttributeBetween
list.description: Sets a specific attribute to all cells forming a straight line between two cells on the grid.

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#setCellAttributes
list.description: Clears or sets global attributes to all cells

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#setCellLocked
list.description: Sets or unsets the locked properties (black cell) to a specific cell.

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#setCharAt
list.description: Sets the specified character as a content of the cell at specified coordinates

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#setChars
list.description: Sets the characters to be placed in the cells of this TextGrid

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#setCursorAt
list.description: Sets the blinking cursor at a specific point

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#setCursorEnabled
list.description: Whether the blinking cursor must be enabled or disabled.

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#setUseCursor
list.description: Sets the useCursor property of this text grid

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#startCursorBlink
list.description: Starts the {@link module:AWT.Timer} that makes the cursor blink.

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#stopCursorBlink
list.description: Stops the {@link module:AWT.Timer} that makes the cursor blink.

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#useCursor
list.description: Whether this grid uses a blinking cursor or not

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#wild
list.description: The character to be used as wildcard

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid#wildTransparent
list.description: Whether the wildcard character is transparent or opaque

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid.createEmptyGrid
list.description: Factory constructor that creates an empty grid based on a {@link module:boxes/TextGridContent.TextGridContent TextGridContent}

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid.defaults
list.description: TextGrid default values

list.title: module:boxes/TextGrid.TextGrid.flags
list.description: Binary flags used to mark status

list.description: Default values

Looks for an already existing {@link module:media/ActiveMediaPlayer.ActiveMediaPlayer ActiveMediaPlayer} equivalent to the requested.
When not found, a new one is created and and returned.

list.description: Removes all players from this media bag

list.description: Stops playing all media elements stored in this bag

list.description: Frees all resources used by this player

list.description: Clears all audio buffers

list.title: module:media/ActiveMediaPlayer.ActiveMediaPlayer#clearAudioBuffer
list.description: Clears the specified audio buffer

list.description: Counts the number of active audio buffers

list.description: Sets the ActiveBox associated to this media player

list.description: The {@link module:bads/MediaBagElement.MediaBagElement} containing the reference to the media to be played

list.description: The MediaContent associated to this player.

list.description: Plays the media when available, without blocking the current thread.

list.title: module:media/ActiveMediaPlayer.ActiveMediaPlayer#playNow
list.description: Plays the media, realizing it if needed.

list.title: module:media/ActiveMediaPlayer.ActiveMediaPlayer#ps
list.description: The player to which this player belongs.

list.title: module:media/ActiveMediaPlayer.ActiveMediaPlayer#realize
list.description: Generates the objects that will play media

list.description: Sets the visual component of this player visible or invisible

list.title: module:media/ActiveMediaPlayer.ActiveMediaPlayer#stop
list.description: Stops the media playing

list.title: module:media/ActiveMediaPlayer.ActiveMediaPlayer#stopAllAudioBuffers
list.description: Stops the playing or recording actions of all audio buffers

list.title: module:media/ActiveMediaPlayer.ActiveMediaPlayer#stopAudioBuffer
list.description: Stops a specific audio buffer

list.title: module:media/ActiveMediaPlayer.ActiveMediaPlayer#useAudioBuffer
list.description: When true, this player makes use of a recording audio buffer

list.title: module:media/ActiveMediaPlayer.ActiveMediaPlayer.AUDIO_BUFFERS
list.description:
Audio buffers used for recording and playing voice are stored in a static array because
they are common to all instances of {@link module:media/ActiveMediaPlayer.ActiveMediaPlayer ActiveMediaPlayer}
Only initialized when {@link module:media/ActiveMediaPlayer.ActiveMediaPlayer#REC_ENABLED REC_ENABLED} is true.

list.title: module:media/ActiveMediaPlayer.ActiveMediaPlayer.REC_ENABLED
list.description:
Recording of audio is enabled only when navigator.getUserMedia and MediaRecorder are defined
In 02-Mar-2016 this is implemented only in Firefox 41 and Chrome 49 or later.
See: {@link https://addpipe.com/blog/mediarecorder-api}

list.description: AudioBuffer constructor

list.description: Array of data chunks collected during the recording

list.description: Clears all data associated to this AudioBuffer

list.description: AudioBuffer is enabled only in browsers with navigator.MediaDevices.getuserMedia

list.title: module:media/AudioBuffer.AudioBuffer#mediaPlayer
list.description: The HTML audio element used to play the recorded sound

list.title: module:media/AudioBuffer.AudioBuffer#mediaRecorder
list.description: The object used to record audio data and convert it to a valid stream for the {@link module:media/ActiveMediaPlayer.ActiveMediaPlayer ActiveMediaPlayer}

list.title: module:media/AudioBuffer.AudioBuffer#play
list.description: Starts playing the currently recorded audio, if any.

list.title: module:media/AudioBuffer.AudioBuffer#playWhenFinished
list.description:
Instructs this AudioBuffer recorder to start playing the collected audio at the end of the
current mediaRecorder task.

list.title: module:media/AudioBuffer.AudioBuffer#record
list.description: Starts recording audio, or stops the recording if already started.

list.title: module:media/AudioBuffer.AudioBuffer#seconds
list.description: Maximum length of recordings allowed to this AudioBuffer (in seconds)

list.title: module:media/AudioBuffer.AudioBuffer#stop
list.description: Stops the current operation, either recording or playing audio

list.title: module:media/AudioBuffer.AudioBuffer#timeoutID
list.description:
The identifier of the timer launched to stop the recording when the maximum time is exceeded.
This member is null when no timeout function is associated to this AudioBuffer

list.title: module:media/AudioBuffer.AudioBuffer#visualFeedbak
list.description:
Set visual feedback to the user while the system is recording audio
Currently changes the cursor pointer associated to the HTML element
containing the recorder.

list.title: module:media/AudioBuffer.AudioBuffer.MAX_RECORD_LENGTH
list.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for recordings (in seconds)

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent
list.description: MediaContent constructor

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#absLocation
list.description: Places the video window at a specific location.

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#absLocationFrom
list.description:
When {@link module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#absLocation} is not null, this field indicates from where to
measure its coordinates. Valid values are: BOX, WINDOW or FRAME.

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#autoStart
list.description:
When true, the media will automatically start playing when the associated {@link module:boxes/ActiveBox.ActiveBox ActiveBox}
become active.

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#catchMouseEvents
list.description: true when the video window must catch mouse clicks.

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#externalParams
list.description: Optional parameters passed to external calls

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#file
list.description: Media file name

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#free
list.description: When true, the video plays out of the cell, centered on the activity window.

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#from
list.description:
Special setting used to play only a fragment of media. -1 means not used (plays full
length, from the beginning)

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#getAttributes
list.description:
Gets a object with the basic attributes needed to rebuild this instance excluding functions,
parent references, constants and also attributes retaining the default value.
The resulting object is commonly usued to serialize elements in JSON format.

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#getDescription
list.description:
Gets a string representing this media content, useful for checking if two different elements
are equivalent.

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#getIcon
list.description: Returns an image to be used as icon for representing this media content.

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#isEquivalent
list.description: Compares this object with another MediaContent.

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#length
list.description:
When type is RECORD_AUDIO, this member stores the maximum length of the recorded
sound, in seconds.

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#level
list.description:
The priority level is important when different medias want to play together. Objects with
highest priority level can mute lower ones.

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#loop
list.description: Whether to repeat the media in loop, or just one time.

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#recBuffer
list.description:
When type is RECORD_AUDIO, this member stores the buffer ID where the recording
will be stored.

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#setAttributes
list.description: Reads the properties of this MediaContent from a data object

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#setProperties
list.description: Loads the MediaContent settings from a specific JQuery XML element

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#stretch
list.description: Whether to stretch or not the video size to fit the cell space.

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#to
list.description:
Special setting used to play only a fragment of media. -1 means not used (plays to the end
of the media)

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#toString
list.description: Returns a simplified description of this media content. Useful for accessibility methods.

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent#type
list.description:
The type of media. Valid values are: UNKNOWN, PLAY_AUDIO, PLAY_VIDEO,
PLAY_MIDI, PLAY_CDAUDIO, RECORD_AUDIO, PLAY_RECORDED_AUDIO, RUN_CLIC_ACTIVITY,
RUN_CLIC_PACKAGE, RUN_EXTERNAL, URL, EXIT and RETURN

list.title: module:media/MediaContent.MediaContent.ICONS
list.description: Collection of icon {@link external:HTMLImageElement} objects

list.title: module:media/MediaContent~ICONS
list.description: Default icons for media types.

list.description: Starts or resumes playing

list.description: Plays a MIDI event

list.description: When >0, time position at which the music must end

list.description: The grimmdude's MidiPlayer used by this player

list.title: module:media/MidiAudioPlayer.MidiAudioPlayer#startedNotes
list.description:
This array is used when processing 'Note off' events to stop notes that are currently playing.
It contains a collection of 'instrument.play' instances, one for each active note

list.title: module:media/MidiAudioPlayer.MidiAudioPlayer.MIDISoundFontBase
list.description:
The URL used as base for the current collection of MIDI soundfonts.
This value can be overwritten by the global parameter MIDISoundFontBase

list.title: module:media/MidiAudioPlayer.MidiAudioPlayer.MIDISoundFontExtension
list.description:
An extension to be added to MIDISoundFontName in order to build the full file name of the soundfont JS file.
Current valid options are -mp3.js and -ogg.js
This value can be overwritten by the global parameter MIDISoundFontExtension

list.title: module:media/MidiAudioPlayer.MidiAudioPlayer.MIDISoundFontName
list.description:
The MIDI instrument name.
This value can be overwritten by the global parameter MIDISoundFontName
See MIDI.js Soundfonts for full lists of MIDI instrument names.

list.title: module:media/MidiAudioPlayer.MidiAudioPlayer.MIDISoundFontObject
list.description:
An object containing the full soundfont data used by {@link module:media/MidiAudioPlayer.MidiAudioPlayer#instrument instrument}
When this member is set, no other settings related to the sounfFont will be used.
This value can be overwritten by the global parameter MIDISoundFontObject

list.title: module:media/MidiAudioPlayer.MidiAudioPlayer.audioContext
list.description: The {@link external:AudioContext} used by this MIDI player.

list.title: module:media/MidiAudioPlayer.MidiAudioPlayer.instrument
list.description:
The "Instrument" object used by this MIDI player.
See: https://github.com/danigb/soundfont-player

list.title: module:media/MidiAudioPlayer.MidiAudioPlayer.loadingInstrument
list.description: A flag used to avoid re-entrant calls to {@link module:media/MidiAudioPlayer.MidiAudioPlayer#prepareInstrument prepareInstrument}

list.title: module:media/MidiAudioPlayer.MidiAudioPlayer.prepareInstrument
list.description:
Initializes the soundfont instrument, loading data from GitHub
NOTE: This will not work when off-line!
TODO: Provided a basic, simple, static soundfont

calculates the final score obtained by the user in this activity.
The algorithm used takes in account the minimal number of actions needed, the actions
really done by the user, and if the activity was finally solved or not.

list.description: true only when the user has finished and solved the activity
